query: What topic will the speaker give a gentle introduction to, assuming the audience may not be familiar with it?

ground_truth.text: ...many of you maybe have not seen this area of combinatorial reconfiguration...

query: What are the two main reconfiguration models discussed for the independent set problem (phrased as token placement)?

ground_truth.text: ...defining the rule for independent sets... token jumping... token sliding...

query: According to the speaker, what makes combinatorial reconfiguration problems enjoyable to work on?

ground_truth.text: ...the questions are so nice to state... accessible really to researchers at any level...

query: Who collaborated with the speaker on the work presented?

ground_truth.text: ...joint work with valentin barchet, nicola bousquet, clement dalard, and carl lomer...

query: What puzzle is used as the primary example to introduce combinatorial reconfiguration?

ground_truth.text: ...the best way i think to introduce is with a familiar example... the 15 puzzle game.

query: How is the "reconfiguration graph" or "state space" defined in the context of the 15-puzzle example?

ground_truth.text: ...we have one vertex or one node in this graph for each possible configuration...

query: What is the reconfiguration rule described for the graph k-coloring problem?

ground_truth.text: ...can you recolor alpha to get to beta? but you need to recolor one vertex at a time...

query: Which complexity class contains decision problems solvable with a polynomial amount of space, and why is it relevant to reconfiguration problems?

ground_truth.text: ...p-space is the set of all decision problems that can be solved using a polynomial amount of space...

query: What surprising complexity result is mentioned regarding the 3-recoloring problem compared to the standard 3-coloring problem?

ground_truth.text: ...coloring is np-complete even for k equals 3... recoloring problem for k equals 3, it's actually polynomial time solvable.

query: What parameters are mentioned for studying the parameterized complexity of token reconfiguration problems?

ground_truth.text: ...obvious parameter would be the number of tokens... tree width or path width...

query: What specific algorithm allows the 3-recoloring problem to be solved in polynomial time?
What is the exact diameter ("God's number") of the reconfiguration graph for the standard 15-puzzle?
Are there specific examples of how token sliding reconfiguration is applied in robotics path planning?
What is the complexity of the token sliding problem on even-hole-free graphs?
What was the specific name or location of the combinatorial reconfiguration workshop where the joint work for this project began almost two years prior to the talk?
